editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.
editorialNotes.short: Play on a new map.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Tear apart the world to rebuild it in this creative post-apocalyptic survival game with an upgrade system that compels us to explore and experiment.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Unravel family secrets on a remote island cursed by plagues in this dark puzzle adventure.

editorialNotes.standard: Investigate a gorgeous alien world while dominating turn-based battles with precisely timed combos in this superbly written RPG.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Jump in the DeLorean time machine and head back to the ’80s, an era when chiptunes and 8-bit graphics ruled the gaming world. This sly parody mashes up everything from the open-world action of Grand Theft Auto to the sneaky stealth of Metal Gear—the classic original versions, of course. It’s also stuffed with giggle-worthy references to some of our favorite old-school games and movies. From vehicular mayhem to gun battles to hanging out with a certain gang of adolescent ninja reptiles, it’s our retro-flavored dream come true.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Typically when you love something, you don’t tear it up. But in this Apple Design Award winner, you’ll need to rip and rearrange each stage to help your lil’ alien buddies reach their spaceship. The design is superb, the music is wonderful. But hands-down the best thing about this puzzler? It feels totally original.
editorialNotes.short: Slice apart stages and help cute creatures find safety.

editorialNotes.tagline: Use sound to escape the darkness

name: 剑之痕-经典格斗动作手游
artistName: 上海绽放网络科技有限公司

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: If you could do it all again, what would you change?

name: Tick Tock: A Tale for Two

ios.subtitle: A story of beauty and illusion

editorialNotes.standard: We couldn’t wait to go back to the land of twisty towers and uncanny beauty—and this sequel didn’t let us down. With its striking colours and level design, it’s even more stunning than the first game. New elements like light beams and controlling two characters make the puzzles even trickier. The bond between that mother and child is what we’ll remember most, though—their relationship moved us in a way few games do.
editorialNotes.short: An unforgettable adventure full of challenging puzzles and gorgeous visuals.

editorialNotes.standard: For builders and tinkerers, the planet Woanope couldn’t be a better place to be stranded. It’s overflowing with flowers, crystals, animals and a zillion other resources you can quickly craft into everything from comfy furniture to vicious weapons. A never-ending string of new locations and inventions keeps this survival RPG engrossing, and its oddball humour pulls you in even more. We looked forward to every wacky conversation with our robo-companion and random alien creatures—and to the awesome discoveries we’d make when they sent us on quests.
editorialNotes.short: Fight monsters. Chop down trees. Build new things. It's a survivalist's delight.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Mesmerising from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, you’ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. It’s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwo’s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.
editorialNotes.short: Traverse mind-bending levels that are structurally impossible

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Explore endless vertical worlds controlling a four-legged alien.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Engage in dramatic mech warfare to protect mankind from invading monsters.
editorialNotes.standard: Booming with anime-style action, Implosion feels like it was forged in some techno-marvel future. Spectacular visuals and spellbinding music bolster an epic tale that pits you—one of Earth’s few survivors—against the monsters who stole our homeworld. Fighting in your War-Mech battle suit’s a blast, with legions of ghastly foes ready for your lethal sword and fearsome firepower. If you like games long on style and ambition, this one’s for you.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Decide the fate of your kingdom
editorialNotes.standard: This game, one of the Best of 2016, absolutely floored us. It seems straightforward at first—you’re a king, and you’re presented with choices about how to rule as a deck of cards. Swipe right to choose one path and swipe left for another. But there’s so very much more going on, and without spoiling anything, Reigns’ cleverness, humour and sometimes agonising choices routinely surprised and always delighted us.
editorialNotes.short: Decide the fate of your kingdom in this exceptionally clever adventure.
A chilling experience that's super rewarding.
editorialNotes.standard: Now here’s how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this series—its chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles and beautiful visuals—while making masterful enhancements. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: A heart-wrenching world of life-or-death decision making.
The ultimate outcome is up to you in this incredible tale of survival.
editorialNotes.standard: The first in a series of groundbreaking text adventures, Lifeline kept us in suspense the whole time, desperately awaiting the next message from marooned astronaut Taylor. As you receive text notifications telling you what Taylor’s doing, you reply with instructions on which way to travel, whether to explore a derelict ship and other crucial decisions. The tension mounts as you try to help the castaway survive, and the option to rewind and pick different choices makes the game wonderfully replayable.

editorialNotes.short: Travel a spellbinding paper world.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Originally released in 2000, Final Fantasy IX set a new standard for the series—and it’s still astoundingly impressive. It’s a perfect blend of beloved RPG elements from previous entries and modernised battle encounters. As you make your way through the story’s twists and turns, you’ll encounter unforgettable characters, frighteningly powerful enemies and a wonderful fantasy world to explore.

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time

editorialNotes.standard: This brings together all the Toca Life apps, letting your beloved characters from different apps mingle in one beautiful world – a world that keeps growing with new areas to explore and characters to meet.
editorialNotes.short: Search for hidden people and objects in detailed, hand-drawn landscapes.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: One of the most influential RPGs of all time, Final Fantasy VII takes you on an unforgettable journey through a harsh and unforgiving sci-fi landscape. Packed with tense turn-based combat and an extraordinary story, Square Enix’s masterpiece is as exhilarating now as it was when it was first released in 1997.

editorialNotes.tagline: Team up to solve the puzzles

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Thanks, space crooks! Because of you, we’re back in the saddle, enforcing the law in one of our favourite wild-west futures. Like last time, the gorgeous, open-ended levels do a stellar job of rewarding stealthy tactics and in-your-face gunplay—your choice. Whether we snuck or shot our way through enemy hideouts, we had a blast.
editorialNotes.short: Bring the law to the wild frontiers of space.

editorialNotes.standard: Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.

ios.subtitle: A story about love and life

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Take to the seas to explore a stunning world.
editorialNotes.tagline: Gear up for a thrilling journey

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: See the world.

ios.subtitle: A game about life, loss & hope

editorialNotes.standard: An Apple Design Award winner, this moving puzzler proves sometimes the best stories don’t need words. Developer Broken Rules has created a hand-drawn world that bubbles with whimsy and heart. Altering the landscape to reveal hidden paths makes for fascinating, peaceful gameplay. We love exploring the storybook settings and uncovering each touching memory. It’s unforgettable, and we’d move mountains just to relive the experience.
editorialNotes.short: Experience the meditative voyage of a gentleman puzzling through his past.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: A suspenseful story with thrilling puzzles
editorialNotes.standard: The concept alone bowls us over. You’re rearranging panels in an interactive comic—changing the outcome on each page until your sneaky spy avoids danger. But Framed’s puzzle play isn’t the only thing that thrilled us. We got so caught up in the suspenseful story and moody visuals, all we could think about at the end was giving it another go.

name: Ridiculous Fishing - A Tale of Redemption

editorialNotes.short: The title is not misleading. This is not a simulation. This is pure entertainment.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Imagine WALL·E directed by Tim Burton—that’s the weird, wonderful world of Machinarium. But this cute robot’s quest for love combines tons more influences—like point-and-click adventures, hidden-object puzzlers, and comic books—for a truly unique experience. Challenging but full of awesome “aha!” moments, it’s an artistic odyssey that looks amazing on iPhone, iPad, or Apple TV.
